docs.lead_paragraph: ANOTHER SEVERELY BEATEN BY ROWDIES--Mr. THOMAS THOMAS, of Eleventh-street, near Fifth-avenue, Gowanus, while going home between 11 and 12 o'clock Saturday night last, was attacked on Fifth-avenue near Sixteenth-street, by three men, who beat him so severely that he is considered dangerously injured.
docs.abstract: A paid Department demanded in Brooklyn

headline.main: Thurlow Weed's Return to Editorial Life.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than two years ago the then Seminor Editor of this journal, desiring exemption from the responsibilities of his position, rather than from duties strictly professional, (for they were ever congenial,) sold his interest in the establishment to SAMUEL WILKESON, EEq., of Buffalo. That gentleman, fitted by elucation, talents and experience, as well as by the soundness and fidelity of his principles, for the duties he assumed,

docs.lead_paragraph: SUDDEN DEATH OF EX-ALDEEMAN DELAMATER.--About 6 1/2 o'clock yesterday morning the wife of Mr. SAMUEL DELAMATER, residing in Twenty-third-street, was awakened by a groan, and, turning to ascertain the cause, found her husband lying in the agonies of death beside her. He expired almost immediately. His death was caused by apoplexy.

headline.main: Treatment of American Citizens by the Peruvian Government-Apathy of our own Government.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: Having lately seen a published account of a gross and wanton outrage of the Peruvian Government on the personal and international rights of Dr. CHARLES EASTON, of Pennsylvania, I profit by the occasion to add to that one a statement of a similarly disgraceful transaction, equally notorious, and strikingly illustrative of the injustice and circumvention of Peruvian diplomacy.
docs.abstract: Peter Tyler upon the outrages to Am. Citizens

headline.main: Fashion at Washington--The Last Drawing Room of the Season at the Executive Mansion--Party at Gen. Case'--Speaker Orr's Dinners--Theatricals.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our " season" is almost over, and the announcement that the drawing room of to-night was to be the last, insured a full attendance, although the weather was emphatically what the cockneys term "nasty." The rain fell in torrents,

docs.lead_paragraph: General MOURAVIEFF has made his name doubly memorable in the Russian history. By his capture of Kars in Asia Minor, which capitulated to the army under his command almost at the same time that Sebastopol was stormed by the Allies, he opened the way to an honorable peace between the Czar and his Western antagonists;
